definitions: experiencing extreme fear or anxiety when in small or enclosed spaces
causing feelings of being trapped or confined in an uncomfortably small space
examples: She felt claustrophobic in the crowded elevator
His claustrophobic panic attacks made flying difficult
The tiny apartment had a claustrophobic atmosphere
The claustrophobic tunnel made everyone feel anxious

definitions: equipped with sharp curved nails on the feet or hands for gripping
examples: The clawed creature left marks on the tree
A clawed hammer helps remove nails easily
The cat's clawed paws scratched the furniture
The clawed lobster escaped from the tank

definitions: consisting of or containing a large proportion of clay in the soil
examples: The clayey soil retained water after heavy rain
Farmers avoided the clayey fields during planting season
Her boots stuck in the clayey ground
The clayey riverbank was perfect for making pottery

definitions: executed in a precise, neat manner without messiness or rough edges
maintaining habits of cleanliness and good hygiene in daily life
examples: The surgeon made a cleanly incision during surgery
He cleanly caught the ball with one hand
She lived in a cleanly manner, always organized
Their cleanly habits impressed the health inspector

definitions: removing dirt, impurities, or unwanted elements to make something pure
examples: The cleansing ritual prepared them for the ceremony
Use a cleansing lotion to remove makeup completely
The cleansing rain washed away the dust
A cleansing diet helps eliminate toxins naturally

definitions: having removed all objects, obstructions, or contents from a space
having received official permission or approval after investigation or review
examples: The cleared table was ready for dinner service
Workers cleared the snow from the driveway
She was cleared of all charges against her
The pilot was cleared for immediate takeoff

definitions: having a split, crack, or division creating two distinct parts
examples: His cleft chin gave him a distinctive appearance
The earthquake created a cleft in the ground
The cleft palate required surgical correction
A cleft rock provided shelter from the storm

definitions: showing mercy and leniency, especially regarding weather or punishment
examples: The clement weather made for perfect picnic conditions
The judge was clement with first-time offenders
We enjoyed clement temperatures throughout our vacation
His clement disposition made him a beloved teacher

definitions: held or squeezed tightly closed, especially regarding fists or teeth
examples: His clenched fists showed his growing anger
She spoke through clenched teeth during the argument
The child's clenched jaw indicated stress
Her clenched hands revealed her nervousness

definitions: involving routine office tasks such as filing, typing, and record-keeping
connected with the clergy or religious officials and their duties
examples: She performed clerical duties at the law firm
The job posting required strong clerical skills
The clerical collar identified him as a priest
Clerical robes were worn during the ceremony

definitions: constituting or relating to the most intense or important point of something
examples: The movie's climactic scene left audiences breathless
The climactic battle determined the war's outcome
Her climactic speech moved everyone to tears
The climactic moment arrived after hours of buildup

definitions: connected with the weather conditions typical of an area over time
examples: Climatic changes affect agricultural production significantly
The region's climatic conditions favor wine production
Scientists study climatic patterns to predict weather
Climatic data helps farmers plan their crops

definitions: definitively settled or secured, especially regarding deals or victories
examples: They clinched the championship with that final goal
She clinched the deal with her excellent presentation
His testimony clinched the case for the prosecution
The team clinched their playoff spot last night

definitions: trimmed or cut to be shorter than the original length
speaking in a brief, sharp manner that seems unfriendly
examples: Her clipped hair gave her a professional look
The hedge was neatly clipped into geometric shapes
His clipped tone suggested he was annoyed
She gave clipped responses during the interview

definitions: covered with or as if with a cloak to conceal from view
examples: The mountain was cloaked in morning mist
Her true intentions remained cloaked in mystery
The spy's identity was carefully cloaked
Darkness cloaked their escape from the building

definitions: moving in the same circular direction as the hands of a clock
examples: Turn the knob clockwise to increase the volume
The dancers moved clockwise around the maypole
Tighten the screw by turning it clockwise
The hurricane spiraled clockwise across the ocean

definitions: blocked or filled with something that prevents normal flow or movement
examples: The clogged drain caused water to back up
Traffic remained clogged for hours after the accident
His clogged arteries required immediate medical attention
The clogged filter reduced the engine's performance

definitions: creating an obstruction that prevents normal flow or movement
examples: Grease was clogging the kitchen pipes slowly
The clogging traffic made everyone late for work
Fallen leaves were clogging the rain gutters
The clogging effect of cholesterol concerns doctors

definitions: kept away from the outside world in a quiet, secluded environment
examples: The cloistered monks rarely left their monastery
Her cloistered upbringing left her unprepared for college
The cloistered courtyard provided peaceful meditation space
They lived a cloistered existence in the countryside

definitions: in the process of ending or shutting down operations
occurring at or forming the end of an event or period
examples: The closing ceremony marked the Olympics' end
Closing time at the library is nine o'clock
Her closing remarks summarized the main points perfectly
The closing chapter revealed the mystery's solution

definitions: dressed in garments rather than being naked or partially dressed
examples: The statue was clothed in flowing marble robes
She was fully clothed despite the hot weather
The trees were clothed in autumn colors
He remained clothed throughout the medical examination

definitions: made unclear, confused, or difficult to understand
covered or darkened by clouds in the sky
examples: His judgment was clouded by personal feelings
The scandal clouded her political career
The clouded sky threatened rain all afternoon
Her clouded expression showed deep concern

definitions: having many clouds in the sky that block sunlight
lacking clarity or transparency, appearing murky or opaque
examples: The cloudy weather ruined our beach plans
Tomorrow will be cloudy with occasional showers
The water looked cloudy after stirring the sediment
Her cloudy eyes suggested she needed glasses

definitions: completely lacking knowledge or understanding about something important
examples: He seemed clueless about basic cooking skills
The clueless tourist got lost downtown
She was clueless about her surprise party
Their clueless response showed they hadn't studied

definitions: moving or acting without skill or grace, often causing accidents
examples: His clumsy attempts at dancing amused everyone
The clumsy waiter dropped several plates
She made a clumsy apology for her mistake
The clumsy repair job made things worse

definitions: solid, heavy, and awkward in appearance or movement
examples: The clunky old computer took forever to start
Her clunky boots made walking difficult
The software's clunky interface frustrated users
He wore clunky jewelry from the 1970s

definitions: gathered or growing in a group of similar things close together
examples: The clustered houses formed a small village
Stars clustered together create stunning constellation views
The clustered data points suggested a pattern
Wildflowers clustered around the old oak tree

definitions: filled with too many objects in a disorganized, messy way
examples: Her cluttered desk made finding documents difficult
The cluttered room desperately needed organizing
His cluttered mind couldn't focus on tasks
The cluttered garage had no parking space

definitions: combined or merged together to form one mass or whole
examples: The small groups coalesced into one large movement
The raindrops coalesced into larger puddles
Their ideas coalesced into a brilliant plan
The coalesced particles formed a solid mass

definitions: in the process of combining or merging to form a single entity
examples: The coalescing clouds signaled an approaching storm
Different cultures were coalescing in the city
The coalescing opinions formed a consensus
Oil droplets were coalescing on the water's surface

definitions: having a rough or harsh texture that feels unpleasant
lacking refinement or delicacy in behavior or language
examples: The coarse sand irritated her sensitive skin
He preferred coarse salt for cooking
His coarse language offended the dinner guests
The comedian's coarse humor wasn't appropriate

definitions: covered with a thin layer of a particular substance
examples: The candy was coated with chocolate
The pills were coated to make swallowing easier
The coated wire resisted corrosion better
Her coated tongue indicated she was sick

definitions: relating to the dialect or accent traditionally associated with East London
examples: His cockney accent revealed his London origins
She loved listening to cockney rhyming slang
The cockney flower seller charmed the tourists
The play featured authentic cockney dialogue

definitions: showing excessive confidence in oneself in an annoying way
examples: His cocky attitude annoyed his teammates greatly
The cocky student thought the test was easy
She became less cocky after failing the exam
The cocky boxer underestimated his opponent

definitions: arranged and set down in a systematic code or set of rules
examples: The codified laws made legal proceedings clearer
Their codified procedures ensured consistent quality
The codified rules eliminated confusion among players
Ancient customs were codified into written law

definitions: providing education for both male and female students together
examples: The coeducational school promoted gender equality
They switched from single-sex to coeducational classes
Most universities are now fully coeducational institutions
The coeducational environment prepared students for real life

definitions: using force or threats to make someone do something against their will
examples: The government banned coercive interrogation techniques
His coercive tactics violated company policy
She resisted the coercive pressure to conform
Coercive measures rarely produce lasting compliance

definitions: living or existing together at the same time or place peacefully
examples: The coexisting cultures enriched the neighborhood
Multiple religions were coexisting harmoniously
The coexisting species shared the same habitat
Traditional and modern values were coexisting

definitions: expressed clearly and persuasively, making a strong logical argument
examples: She presented cogent reasons for the policy change
His cogent analysis convinced the board members
The lawyer's cogent argument swayed the jury
They needed cogent evidence to support their claim

definitions: having the same linguistic origin or descended from the same source
examples: English and German are cognate languages
The cognate words share similar meanings
These cognate terms evolved from Latin roots
Linguists study cognate relationships between languages

definitions: having knowledge or being aware of something through observation or information
examples: She remained cognizant of potential safety risks
The committee was cognizant of budget limitations
Be cognizant of cultural differences when traveling
He wasn't cognizant of the new regulations

definitions: logical and consistent, with all parts fitting together in a clear way
examples: She struggled to form coherent sentences when tired
The report presented a coherent analysis of data
His coherent explanation clarified the complex topic
The plan lacked coherent structure and organization

definitions: forming a united whole where all parts work well together
examples: The cohesive team worked efficiently toward their goal
A cohesive narrative held the novel together
The cohesive community supported each other through crisis
They needed more cohesive policies across departments

definitions: wound or arranged in a connected series of circles or rings
examples: The coiled rope lay ready for use
A coiled snake prepared to strike
Her coiled hair created an elegant updo
The coiled spring stored potential energy

definitions: arranging or winding something in a spiral or series of circles
examples: The snake was coiling around the tree branch
She was coiling the garden hose after use
Smoke was coiling upward from the chimney
The coiling vines covered the entire wall

definitions: happening at the same time or occupying the same space
examples: The two events were coincident but not related
Their arrivals were coincident with the announcement
The coincident trends suggested a common cause
These coincident factors created perfect conditions

definitions: occurring by chance at the same time without any causal connection
examples: Their meeting at the airport was purely coincidental
The coincidental timing raised suspicions unnecessarily
It was coincidental that they wore matching outfits
The similar names were entirely coincidental

definitions: happening at exactly the same time or in the same place
examples: The holidays were coinciding with final exams
Their vacations were coinciding perfectly this year
The coinciding events created scheduling conflicts
Two meetings were coinciding in the conference room

definitions: involving two or more people working together to achieve something
examples: The collaborative project brought together multiple departments
She preferred collaborative learning over individual study
Their collaborative effort produced excellent results
The collaborative workspace encouraged teamwork

definitions: designed to fold down into a compact size for storage or transport
examples: The collapsible chair fit easily in the car
They bought collapsible containers for leftovers
His collapsible bicycle was perfect for commuting
The collapsible tent set up in minutes
